To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: First recording is part 2 of a recording titled Phil Harris Day, featuring Phil Harris (host/performer), David Cobb (announcer) and Ott Devine (announcer) on July 28, 1951 located at Sulpher Dell Park in Nashville, Tenn. Second recording is an excerpt from WSM program Sunday Down South, sponsored by Lion Oil. Originally broadcast 1949-07-31 (unconfirmed), part 1. Personnel include Louie Buck (host), Ott Devine (announcer), Beasley Smith (conductor) and the Lion Orchestra (performer), Snooky Lanson (performer), Dottie Dillard (performer), the Old Hickory Singers (performers), and Charlie Ackerson (performer).

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
recordInfo.recordOrigin: Record has been transformed into MODS v3.5 from a Qualified Dublin Core record by the Digital Library of Tennessee, a service hub of the Digital Public Library of America.
